revision.comment: updated/ added better picture for Ouroboros
revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} The following is a list of '''[[symbol]]s''' associated with the '''[[occult]]'''. This list shares a number of entries with the list of [[alchemical symbol]]s as well as the [[list of sigils of demons]]. {{Expand list|date=May 2019}} __TOC__
==List==
{| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Name !! Image !! Origins !! Notes |- | [[Ankh]] || [[File:Ankh.svg|100px]] || [[Ancient Egyptian religion]] || Ancient Egyptian symbol for eternal life; now also associated with [[Kemetism]] and [[neo-paganism]]. |- | Arrow ([[Belomancy]]) || [[File:19th century knowledge archery arrow feathers.jpg|100px]] || Ancient [[divination]] || Arrows used to gain knowledge through divination. |- | [[Baphomet]] || [[File:Baphomet.png|100px]] || [[Knights Templar]] || Adopted by modern occultists and Satanists after the Knights Templar were accused of worshiping it. [[Theistic Satanism|Theistic Satanists]] worship it as a deity or demon, while [[LaVeyan Satanism|atheistic Satanists]] see it as a metaphorical symbol. However, the goat-headed Baphomet image seen here is a 19th century creation first appearing in ''[[Dogme et Rituel de la Haute Magie]]'' (1856) by Christian occultist [[Éliphas Lévi]]. It was not originally created as a Satanic symbol and is not representative of the Baphomet associated with the Knights Templar. See also: [[Sigil of Baphomet]] and [[Statue of Baphomet]]. |- | [[Black Sun (symbol)|Black Sun]] || [[File:BlackSun.svg|100px]] || Nazi occultism and later the neo-Nazi movement || A symbol of the sun composed of twelve [[Sowilō|sig runes]] first appearing on the floor of the north tower of [[Wewelsburg]] after [[Heinrich Himmler]] ordered it to be remodeled, it gained modern popularity due to [[Occultism in Nazism|its use by Nazi occultists]]. It was later adopted by Satanists. The name "Black Sun" was coined by Wilhelm Landig of the [[Landig Group]]. |- | [[Circled dot]] || [[File:Sun symbol.svg|100px]] || [[Alchemy]] || The alchemical symbol for the sun and various sun gods. Also the alchemical symbol for gold. |- | [[Cross of Saint Peter]] || [[File:Peter's Cross.svg|100px]] || [[Christianity]], later adopted by [[Satanism]] || Used paradoxically both as a symbol of [[Saint Peter]] and as [[Anti-Christian sentiment]]. The symbol comes from the crucifixion of Saint Peter, in which he requested to be crucified upside-down as he didn't see himself as worthy to die the same way as Jesus. |- | [[Eye of Horus]] || [[File:Eye of Horus Right.svg|100px]] || [[Ancient Egyptian religion]] || The eye of the god [[Horus]], a symbol of protection, now associated with the occult and [[Kemetism]]. |- | [[Eye of Providence]] (or the all-seeing eye of God) || [[File:ChristianEyeOfProvidence.svg|100px]] || [[Christian iconography]] || The eye of God within a triangle and surrounded by holy light, representing His omniscience. |- | [[Heptagram]] || [[File:Star_polygon_7-2.svg|100px]] [[File:Star_polygon_7-3.svg|100px]] || Judaism, Christianity, Islam, Thelema, Paganism, Alchemy || In Christianity, it represents the seven days of creation. In Islam, it represents the first seven verses of the Quran. It is the symbol of [[Babalon]] in Thelema. In Wicca, it is known as the Elven Star, Fairy Star, or Septagram. |- | [[Hexagram]] || [[File:Star polygon 6-2.svg|100px]] || [[Mandala]] and [[Judaism]] || An ancient symbol of the Jewish faith, also found on the [[Seal of Solomon]]. |- | [[Icelandic magical staves]] || [[File:Aegishjalmr.svg|100px]] || Icelandic magic || Sigils created with magical powers by the Icelandic people. Pictured is the stave known as [[Helm of Awe|Ægishjálmur]]. |- | [[Monas Hieroglyphica]] || [[File:DeeHieroglyph.gif]] || the works of [[John Dee]] || A symbol invented by [[John Dee]], [[alchemy|alchemist]] and [[astrology|astrologer]] at the court of [[Elizabeth I]] of [[England]]. It represents (from top to bottom): the moon; the sun; the elements; and fire. |- | [[Ouroboros]] ||[[File:Ouroboros-Zanaq.svg|alt=|103x103px]]|| Ancient Egypt and Persia || A serpent or dragon consuming its own tail, it is a symbol of infinity, unity, and the cycle of death and rebirth. |- | [[Pentacle]] || [[File:Golden Dawn Earth Pentacle.svg|100px]] || European witchcraft || A type of talisman used in magical evocation. In occultism, it is synonymous with [[Sigil (magic)|sigil]], while in paganism it is synonymous with [[pentagram]]. These are two different definitions for the same term. |- | [[Pentagram]] || [[File:Pentagram_within_circle.svg|100px]] || Mesopotamia || An ancient symbol of a unicursal five-pointed star circumscribed by a circle with many meanings, including but not limited to, the five wounds of Christ and the five elements (earth, fire, water, air, and soul). In Satanism, it is flipped upside-down. See also: [[Sigil of Baphomet]]. |- | [[Rose Cross]] || [[File:Rosycross-Tetragrammaton.svg|100px]] [[File:Rose_Cross_Lamen.svg|100px]] || [[Rosicrucianism]] / [[Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn]] || A symbol associated with [[Christian Rosenkreuz]] with many different attributions of symbolism. |- | [[Runes]] || [[File:CodexRunicus.jpeg|100px]] || [[Norse mythology]] || Ancient magical symbols used by Norsemen, used in modern times by various religious faiths, such as [https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asatru Asatru]. They were popular among [[Occultism in Nazism|Nazi occultists]]. |- | [[Seal of Solomon]] || [[Image:Seal of Solomon (Simple Version).svg|100px]] [[File:Goetia_seal_of_solomon.svg|100px]] || [[Alchemy]], Christian and Islamic esotericism || A ring attributed to [[King Solomon]] in Jewish and esoteric tradition. |- | Seal of the [[Theosophical Society]] || [[File:Theosophicalsealfrench.svg|100px]] || [[Theosophy (Blavatskian)]] || A seal consisting of a [[Swastika]], [[Star of David]], [[Ankh]], [[Om]], and [[Ouroboros]], used by the Theosophical Society, an organization formed in 1875 to advance Theosophy. |- | Septenary Sigil || [[File:Ona.svg|100px]] || [[Order of Nine Angles]] || The main symbol of the Order of Nine Angles, a neo-Nazi Satanic and Left-hand occult group based in the United Kingdom. |- | [[Sigil (magic)|Sigil]] || [[File:72_Goeta_sigils.png|100px]] || [[Renaissance magic]] || Images created for magical purposes, sometimes attributed as signatures of demons, angels, and other beings. |- | Sigil of [[Lucifer]] || [[File:Sigil of Lucifer.svg|100px]] || The ''[[Grimorium Verum]]'' || A sigil attributed to Lucifer himself, used in [[Satanism]] and [[Luciferianism]]. |- | [[Sigil of Baphomet]] || [[File:Seal_of_Baphomet.svg|100px]] [[File:Baphosimb.svg|100px]]|| 19th Century French Occultism || Official emblem of the Church of Satan, consisting of the head of a goat transfixed upon a reversed pentagram flanked by the [[Hebrew]] letters of the word "[[Leviathan]]" (לִוְיָתָן). |- | [[Sigillum Dei]] (Seal of God) || [[File:C2.jpeg|100px]] || Europe, late Middle Ages || A magical diagram, composed of two circles, a pentagram, and three heptagons, and is labeled with the name of God and his angels. |- | Squared circle || [[File:Squaredcircle.svg|100px]] ||[[Alchemy]] || A symbol of the [[Philosopher's stone]]. |- | [[Sriramachakra]] || [[File:SeethaChakramMagicSquare.jpg|100px]] || [[Tamil language|Tamil]] mysticism || A mystic diagram used for astrology. |- | [[Sulfur]] crosses || {{multiple image | align= | direction= | width= | footer=Various alchemical symbols for sulfur | image1= Sulphur.svg | width1=162 | caption1= | image2= Sulfur symbol 2.svg | width2=100 | caption2= | image3= Alchemy sulfur symbol.svg | width3=146 | total_width=250 | height1= 252 | height2= 100 | height3= 150 }} || [[Alchemy]]; [[Satanism]] || Alchemical symbols for sulfur, associated with the [[fire and brimstone]] of Hell. The third pictured is also known as a 'Leviathan Cross' or 'Satan's Cross'. |- | [[Suns in alchemy]] || [[File:Green lion consuming the sun.jpg|100px]] || [[Alchemy]] and [[Hermeticism]] || A symbol used with many different meanings, including but not limited to, gold, [[citrinitas]], sulfur, the divine spark of man, nobility, and incorruptability. |- | [[Sun cross]] || [[File:Crossed circle.svg|100px]] [[File:Coa_Illustration_Cross_Sun.svg|100px]] || [[Iron Age]] religions and later [[gnosticism]] and neo-paganism. || An ancient pagan symbol of the sun, adopted by gnostics, neopagans, and occultists. |- | [[Symbol of Chaos]] || [[File:Chaos star.svg|100px]] [[File:ChaosStar.svg|100px]] || [[Michael Moorcock]], [[Aleister Crowley]] and [[chaos magic]] || A symbol originating from [[The Eternal Champion (novel)|The Eternal Champion]], later adopted by occultists and role-playing games. |- | [[Tetragrammaton]] || [[File:Tetragrammaton scripts.svg|100px]] || [[Judaism]], Kodesh || Considered to be the unspeakable name of God. The four letter name has many pronunciations and can be seen over 7,000 times throughout the Hebrew Bible. |- | [[Tree of Life (Kabbalah)]] || [[File:Tree of life Kircher Hebrew.svg|100px]] [[File:Tree of life bahir Hebrew.svg|100px]] || [[Kabbalah]] || The tree of life is a diagram used in various mystical traditions. It usually consists of 10 nodes symbolizing different archetypes and 22 lines connecting the nodes. The nodes are often arranged into three columns to represent that they belong to a common category |- | [[Unicursal hexagram]] || [[File:Solid_unicursal_hexagram.svg|100px]] [[File:Crowley unicursal hexagram.svg|100px]] || [[Aleister Crowley]]'s [[Thelema]] || Symbol of the [[Thelema]] religion, a hexagram that can be drawn with one line. |- | [[Zodiac Man]] (Homo Signorum, or 'Man of Signs') || [[File:Zodiac man 1702.png|100px]] || [[Astrology]] || A graph correlating zodiacal names with body parts. |}
==See also== *[[List of sigils of demons]] *[[Iconography]] *[[Alchemical symbol]] **[[Planet symbols]]
==References== {{reflist}}
*[https://books.google.com/books?id=2Im0HAAACAAJ& ''Art and Symbols of the Occult: Images of Power and Wisdom''] by James Wasserman ([[Destiny Books]], 1993) *[https://books.google.com/books?id=PY7PPQAACAAJ& ''Masonic and Occult Symbols Illustrated''] by Cathy Burns (Sharing, 1998)
[[Category:Occult]] [[Category:Magic symbols| ]] [[Category:Lists of symbols|Occult Symbols]] [[debulamer]] [[stimulation]] 01010000111
